xediaPolicyMIB.name: xediaPolicyMIB
xediaPolicyMIB.description: This module defines objects for the management of Routing Policies in Xedia devices.

XPolicyName.name: XPolicyName
XPolicyName.description: The unique name used to identify an entry in a policy table.

XPriPolicyName.name: XPriPolicyName
XPriPolicyName.description: The unique name used to identify an entry in a priority policy table. The name must contain at least one priority value which is interpreted in the getnext. This type of name MAY have a '[<priority value>]' prepended for SET/GET requests. It WILL have a '[<priority value>]' prepended for all of GETNext requests. This piece of the index in interpreted in a special way. The name portion is simply a label, while the first portion of the specified priority assignes the relative positon in the tree. Then, the subsesquent priority numbers assign the entry under the top level entry. The format of the names is name.X.Y,...

XPolicyAsString.name: XPolicyAsString
XPolicyAsString.description: The AS string used to match paths.

xpolicyNumRxConfiguredTotal.name: xpolicyNumRxConfiguredTotal
xpolicyNumRxConfiguredTotal.description: The total number of configured 'receive' policies.

xpolicyNumRxConfiguredValid.name: xpolicyNumRxConfiguredValid
xpolicyNumRxConfiguredValid.description: Represents the number of configured 'receive' policies that have a RowStatus of 'active'. This means that they are configured correctly without any conflicts among the elements in the row.

xpolicyNumRxConfiguredInValid.name: xpolicyNumRxConfiguredInValid
xpolicyNumRxConfiguredInValid.description: Represents the number of configured 'receive' policies that have a RowStatus of 'notReady'. This means that they are configured, but have conflicts among the elements in the row.

xpolicyNumRxInUseTotal.name: xpolicyNumRxInUseTotal
xpolicyNumRxInUseTotal.description: Represents the number of 'receive' policies that are currently being used by the run-time application. Normally this number is the same as the number of Configured Valid Policies.

xpolicyNumRxInUseBGP.name: xpolicyNumRxInUseBGP
xpolicyNumRxInUseBGP.description: Represents the number of BGP 'receive' policies that are currently being used by the run-time application.

xpolicyNumRxInUseOSPF.name: xpolicyNumRxInUseOSPF
xpolicyNumRxInUseOSPF.description: Represents the number of OSPF 'receive' policies that are currently being used by the run-time application.

xpolicyNumRxInUseRIP.name: xpolicyNumRxInUseRIP
xpolicyNumRxInUseRIP.description: Represents the number of RIP 'receive' policies that are currently being used by the run-time application.

xpolicyNumRxInUseStatic.name: xpolicyNumRxInUseStatic
xpolicyNumRxInUseStatic.description: Represents the number of static 'receive' policies that are currently being used by the run-time application.

xpolicyNumTxConfiguredTotal.name: xpolicyNumTxConfiguredTotal
xpolicyNumTxConfiguredTotal.description: The total number of configured 'send' policies.

xpolicyNumTxConfiguredValid.name: xpolicyNumTxConfiguredValid
xpolicyNumTxConfiguredValid.description: Represents the number of configured 'send' policies that have a RowStatus of 'active'. This means that they are configured correctly without any conflicts among the elements in the row.

xpolicyNumTxConfiguredInValid.name: xpolicyNumTxConfiguredInValid
xpolicyNumTxConfiguredInValid.description: Represents the number of configured 'send' policies that have a RowStatus of 'notReady'. This means that they are configured, but have conflicts among the elements in the row.

xpolicyNumTxInUseTotal.name: xpolicyNumTxInUseTotal
xpolicyNumTxInUseTotal.description: Represents the number of 'send' policies that are currently being used by the run-time application. Normally this number is the same as the number of Configured Valid Policies.

xpolicyNumTxInUseBGP.name: xpolicyNumTxInUseBGP
xpolicyNumTxInUseBGP.description: Represents the number of BGP 'send' policies that are currently being used by the run-time application.

xpolicyNumTxInUseOSPF.name: xpolicyNumTxInUseOSPF
xpolicyNumTxInUseOSPF.description: Represents the number of OSPF 'send' policies that are currently being used by the run-time application.

xpolicyNumTxInUseRIP.name: xpolicyNumTxInUseRIP
xpolicyNumTxInUseRIP.description: Represents the number of RIP 'send' policies that are currently being used by the run-time application.

xpolicyReceiveTable.name: xpolicyReceiveTable
xpolicyReceiveTable.description: This entity's Route Policy Receive table.

xpolicyReceiveEntry.name: xpolicyReceiveEntry
xpolicyReceiveEntry.description: An entry to the Route Policy Receive Table.

xpolicyRxProtocol.name: xpolicyRxProtocol
xpolicyRxProtocol.description: The protocol from which the update was received.

xpolicyRxPeer.name: xpolicyRxPeer
xpolicyRxPeer.description: The destination IP address of the routing update. If it is zero, then all peers are accepted.

xpolicyRxName.name: xpolicyRxName
xpolicyRxName.description: A unique name for this entry, including the optional priority number, which can be represented in dotted notation. When used, the priority numbers allow hiearchical matching. Format of the string is: <name>.<priority> Examples of strings: name, name.1, name.1.1, name.2

xpolicyRxAddrStart.name: xpolicyRxAddrStart
xpolicyRxAddrStart.description: The base of the IP Address range to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyRxAddrEnd.name: xpolicyRxAddrEnd
xpolicyRxAddrEnd.description: The end of the IP Address range to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyRxAsString.name: xpolicyRxAsString
xpolicyRxAsString.description: A string describing a complete, or partial 'Autonomyous System' inwhich to perform matches. This string uses a limited form of regular expression syntax to define what values of an AS path to match. The special characters used are '^' and '$' to specify 'start' and 'end' respectively. 100 - a path with 100 in it ^100$ - exactly the path of 100 (adjacent AS) ^100 - any path starting with 100 100$ - any path ending with 100 100.200 - a path with the sequence 100.200 in it. note: this is only valid for routes sourced from BGP.

xpolicyRxCommunityId.name: xpolicyRxCommunityId
xpolicyRxCommunityId.description: Allows matching on one of the integers listed in the community attrubute list. This is only valid for routes sourced from BGP.

xpolicyRxLocalPref.name: xpolicyRxLocalPref
xpolicyRxLocalPref.description: A positive four byte integer defining the preference to a matched routes. Higher values assign greater preference. Internal routes use 0xffffffff. note: It is only used for BGP.

xpolicyRxRowStatus.name: xpolicyRxRowStatus
xpolicyRxRowStatus.reference: RFC1903: Textual Conventions for Version 2 of the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMPv2).
xpolicyRxRowStatus.description: This object is used to add and remove entries from the table.

xpolicyRxPrefixMin.name: xpolicyRxPrefixMin
xpolicyRxPrefixMin.description: Minimum length of IP Address prefix to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyRxPrefixMax.name: xpolicyRxPrefixMax
xpolicyRxPrefixMax.description: Maximum length of IP Address prefix to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicySendTable.name: xpolicySendTable
xpolicySendTable.description: This entity's Route Policy Send table.

xpolicySendEntry.name: xpolicySendEntry
xpolicySendEntry.description: An entry to the Route Policy Table.

xpolicyTxProtocol.name: xpolicyTxProtocol
xpolicyTxProtocol.description: The protocol identifying where the update will be sent.

xpolicyTxPeer.name: xpolicyTxPeer
xpolicyTxPeer.description: The destination IP address of the routing update. If zero, then all peers receive them. For OSPF and RIP, this value should be zero. BGP should not use 0.

xpolicyTxName.name: xpolicyTxName
xpolicyTxName.description: A unique name for this entry, including the optional priority number, which can be represented in dotted notation. When used, the priority numbers allow hiearchical matching. Format of the string is: <name>.<priority> Examples of strings: name, name.1, name.1.1, name.2

xpolicyTxSrcProtocol.name: xpolicyTxSrcProtocol
xpolicyTxSrcProtocol.description: The protocol identifying the origin of the update. Often this 'src protocol will be the same as the TX Protocol index. This allows routes learned by BGP to be filtered towards other BGP routes.

xpolicyTxSrcProtSubType.name: xpolicyTxSrcProtSubType
xpolicyTxSrcProtSubType.description: The protocol sub-type discription. Currently, this only applies to OSPF entries.

xpolicyTxAddrStart.name: xpolicyTxAddrStart
xpolicyTxAddrStart.description: The base of the IP Address range to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyTxAddrEnd.name: xpolicyTxAddrEnd
xpolicyTxAddrEnd.description: The end of the IP Address range to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyTxAsString.name: xpolicyTxAsString
xpolicyTxAsString.description: A string describing a complete, or partial 'Autonomyous System' inwhich to perform matches. This string uses a limited form of regular expression syntax to define what values of an AS path to match. The special characters used are '^' and '$' to specify 'start' and 'end' respectively. 100 - a path with 100 in it ^100$ - exactly the path of 100 (adjacent AS) ^100 - any path starting with 100 100$ - any path ending with 100 100.200 - a path with the sequence 100.200 in it. note: this is only valid for routes sourced from BGP.

xpolicyTxCommunityId.name: xpolicyTxCommunityId
xpolicyTxCommunityId.description: Allows matching on one of the integers listed in the community attrubute list. This is only valid for routes sourced from BGP.

xpolicyTxSendOption.name: xpolicyTxSendOption
xpolicyTxSendOption.description: Send action/options taken on 'matching' entries. Never, indicates that routes within the range are not sent to the peer. Normal, allows routes within the specified range to be sent to the peer. Aggregate adds the specified range to routes that are currently within the specified range. In the aggregate case, the range must be a power of two.

xpolicyTxMED.name: xpolicyTxMED
xpolicyTxMED.description: The 'Multi-Exit-Descriminator'. A lower value assigns a higher preference to the route. Normally, the MED attribute ia attached to all matched routes. Except in the case of 0xffffffff, which means the MED will not be sent. note: It is only used for BGP. If it is used (>0), then the 'xpolicyTxSendOption' can NOT be set to 'never'.

xpolicyTxMEDAuto.name: xpolicyTxMEDAuto
xpolicyTxMEDAuto.description: Admininstative status for calculating the 'Multi-Exit-Descriminator' using IGP_metric + 1.

xpolicyTxAsPrepend.name: xpolicyTxAsPrepend
xpolicyTxAsPrepend.description: The number of times to prepend the router's AS to the transmitted AS path in updates to the peer for all matching routes. note: It is only used for BGP. If it is used (>0), then the 'xpolicyTxSendOption' can NOT be set to 'never'.

xpolicyTxSendCommunityId.name: xpolicyTxSendCommunityId
xpolicyTxSendCommunityId.description: The value that is added to the community attribute for all matched routes. note: It is only used for BGP. If it is used (>0), then the 'xpolicyTxSendOption' can NOT be set to 'never'.

xpolicyTxIgpMetricType.name: xpolicyTxIgpMetricType
xpolicyTxIgpMetricType.description: Type of metric being used. Currently, only for defining OSPF internal and external routes.

xpolicyTxIgpMetricAuto.name: xpolicyTxIgpMetricAuto
xpolicyTxIgpMetricAuto.description: Administrative status for generating an 'auto' metric. If set to localPref, the igp's metric is igpMetric - localPref. If set to MED, the the igp's metric is igpMetric + MED. If set to igp, then the entry controls routes imported from one IGP to another.

xpolicyTxNextHopSelf.name: xpolicyTxNextHopSelf
xpolicyTxNextHopSelf.description: Setting this object to the value 'true(1)' will set the BGP NEXT_HOP attribute to the local router address instead of leaving it as it was received from an EBGP peer.

xpolicyTxRowStatus.name: xpolicyTxRowStatus
xpolicyTxRowStatus.reference: RFC1903: Textual Conventions for Version 2 of the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMPv2).
xpolicyTxRowStatus.description: This object is used to add and remove entries from the table.

xpolicyTxPrefixMin.name: xpolicyTxPrefixMin
xpolicyTxPrefixMin.description: Minimum length of IP Address prefix to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyTxPrefixMax.name: xpolicyTxPrefixMax
xpolicyTxPrefixMax.description: Maximum length of IP Address prefix to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyDisplayTable.name: xpolicyDisplayTable
xpolicyDisplayTable.description: This table contains a read-only display of the internally linked list of policy entries.

xpolicyDisplayEntry.name: xpolicyDisplayEntry
xpolicyDisplayEntry.description: Individual piece of text information regarding a policy entry.

xpolicyDisplayIndex.name: xpolicyDisplayIndex
xpolicyDisplayIndex.description: The row number in the table.

xpolicyRxDisplayString.name: xpolicyRxDisplayString
xpolicyRxDisplayString.description: A single text line of information about a particular Receive policy.

xpolicyTxDisplayString.name: xpolicyTxDisplayString
xpolicyTxDisplayString.description: A single text line of information about a particular Send policy.

xpolicyPeerGroupTable.name: xpolicyPeerGroupTable
xpolicyPeerGroupTable.description: This table contains configuration for policy peer group members.

xpolicyPeerGroupIndex.name: xpolicyPeerGroupIndex
xpolicyPeerGroupIndex.description: The index used to identify this peer group.

xpolicyPeerGroupPeer.name: xpolicyPeerGroupPeer
xpolicyPeerGroupPeer.description: The peer contained in this group.

xpolicyPeerGroupRowStatus.name: xpolicyPeerGroupRowStatus
xpolicyPeerGroupRowStatus.reference: RFC1903: Textual Conventions for Version 2 of the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMPv2).
xpolicyPeerGroupRowStatus.description: This object is used to add and remove entries from the table.

xpolicyPriReceiveTable.name: xpolicyPriReceiveTable
xpolicyPriReceiveTable.description: This entity's Route Policy Receive table.

xpolicyPriReceiveEntry.name: xpolicyPriReceiveEntry
xpolicyPriReceiveEntry.description: An entry to the Route Policy Receive Table.

xpolicyPriRxProtocol.name: xpolicyPriRxProtocol
xpolicyPriRxProtocol.description: The protocol from which the update was received.

xpolicyPriRxPeer.name: xpolicyPriRxPeer
xpolicyPriRxPeer.description: The destination IP address of the routing update. If it is zero, then all peers are accepted.

xpolicyPriRxName.name: xpolicyPriRxName
xpolicyPriRxName.description: A unique name for this entry, including the optional priority number, which can be represented in dotted notation. When used, the priority numbers allow hiearchical matching. Format of the string is: <name>.<priority> Examples of strings: name, name.1, name.1.1, name.2

xpolicyPriRxAddrStart.name: xpolicyPriRxAddrStart
xpolicyPriRxAddrStart.description: The base of the IP Address range to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyPriRxAddrEnd.name: xpolicyPriRxAddrEnd
xpolicyPriRxAddrEnd.description: The end of the IP Address range to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyPriRxCommunityId.name: xpolicyPriRxCommunityId
xpolicyPriRxCommunityId.description: Allows matching on one of the integers listed in the community attrubute list. This is only valid for routes sourced from BGP.

xpolicyPriRxLocalPref.name: xpolicyPriRxLocalPref
xpolicyPriRxLocalPref.description: A positive four byte integer defining the preference to a matched routes. Higher values assign greater preference. Internal routes use 0xffffffff. note: It is only used for BGP.

xpolicyPriRxRowStatus.name: xpolicyPriRxRowStatus
xpolicyPriRxRowStatus.reference: RFC1903: Textual Conventions for Version 2 of the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMPv2).
xpolicyPriRxRowStatus.description: This object is used to add and remove entries from the table.

xpolicyPriRxPrefixMin.name: xpolicyPriRxPrefixMin
xpolicyPriRxPrefixMin.description: Minimum length of IP Address prefix to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyPriRxPrefixMax.name: xpolicyPriRxPrefixMax
xpolicyPriRxPrefixMax.description: Maximum length of IP Address prefix to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyPriRxDistance.name: xpolicyPriRxDistance
xpolicyPriRxDistance.description: Administrative distance value to be set to a matched route.

xpolicyPriSendTable.name: xpolicyPriSendTable
xpolicyPriSendTable.description: This entity's Route Policy Send table.

xpolicyPriSendEntry.name: xpolicyPriSendEntry
xpolicyPriSendEntry.description: An entry to the Route Policy Table.

xpolicyPriTxProtocol.name: xpolicyPriTxProtocol
xpolicyPriTxProtocol.description: The protocol identifying where the update will be sent.

xpolicyPriTxPeer.name: xpolicyPriTxPeer
xpolicyPriTxPeer.description: The destination IP address of the routing update. If zero, then all peers receive them. For OSPF and RIP, this value should be zero. BGP should not use 0.

xpolicyPriTxSrcProtSubType.description: The protocol sub-type discription. Currently, this only applies to OSPF entries.

xpolicyPriTxAddrStart.name: xpolicyPriTxAddrStart
xpolicyPriTxAddrStart.description: The base of the IP Address range to match in routing update destinations.

xpolicyPriTxAddrEnd.name: xpolicyPriTxAddrEnd

xpolicyCompliance.name: xpolicyCompliance
xpolicyCompliance.description: The compliance statement for all agents that support this MIB. A compliant agent implements all objects defined in this MIB.

xpolicyAllGroup.description: The set of all accessible objects in this MIB.
